intro: Melocactus calderanus, commonly known as the Calderón melon cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with a distinctive ribbed structure and a dark green to bluish-green stem. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are followed by red, fleshy fruits. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil to thrive. Its slow growth rate makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
